intro: Aspidium thwaitesii, commonly known as the broad-leaf water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its large, floating fronds that can reach up to 30 cm in length. Aspidium thwaitesii plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life.
